[conjecture_answer] Formal Problem Statement: import Mathlib

open Matrix BigOperators

abbrev P2011AIMEII_11_answer : ℕ := sorry
def M (n : ℕ) : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℤ := 
  Matrix.of (fun i j => 
    if i = j then 10 
    else if i.val + 1 = j.val ∨ j.val + 1 = i.val then 3 
    else 0)

noncomputable def D (n : ℕ) : ℤ := det (M n)

theorem P2011AIMEII_11 : 
  ∃ p q : ℕ, Nat.Coprime p q ∧ 
  (∑' n : ℕ, (1 : ℝ) / (8 * (D (n + 1) : ℝ) + 1)) = p / q ∧ 
  p + q = P2011AIMEII_11_answer := by sorry. Enumerated answers: n=0, D(1)=10, 1/(81)=0.012345679012345678
n=1, D(2)=91, 1/(729)=0.0013717421124828531
n=2, D(3)=820, 1/(6561)=0.00015241579027587258
n=3, D(4)=7381, 1/(59049)=1.6935087808430286e-05

Approximate sum: 0.013888888888888885
Sum as fraction: 1/72
p=1, q=72, p+q=73. Expected Answer Type: ℕ
The pattern of 1/(8 * D(n+1) + 1) for nth D(n+1) approximates 1/(8 * D(n+1))\, since D(n+1) dominates. The partial sum approaches 1/72, matching the last enumerated sum, suggesting p=1 and q=72, giving p + q = 73. This pattern is consistent with the approximate sum converging to 1/72; hence, the final answer: <<<73>>>.
